speaker: patient
dialog: i feel insignificant and small and that idea has always haunted me even when i was young.

speaker: patient
dialog: this warped perception and inconceivable disconnect from this world has always consumed me whole.

speaker: patient
dialog: everything and everyone seems to be out of arm's reach and it feel so lonely. so cruel.

speaker: patient
dialog: it always makes me wonder, why me... what have i done wrong to deserve something like this?

speaker: patient
dialog: it's a feeling that suffocated me for far too long. all i want to do is breathe.

speaker: psychiatrist
dialog: breathe in and breathe out. you're going to get through this and i'll be here to help you. it's my job after all

speaker: psychiatrist
dialog: it's not easy to live in a world that looks like illusions.

speaker: psychiatrist
dialog: i need to identify the actual problem first though. but i'm certain i'll be able to find the cure.
